content:
Thunderbird Calendar offers one default 'Home' calendar when Thunderbird is installed. You can use it for everything you create as an Event or Task. You can create other calendars if desired. You can also connect to external calendars such as Gmail Calendar.

re : I have tried syncing, but that doesn't seem to work. When you have added a Calendar that connects to an external server such as Gmail Calendar, then synching will force a server connection to ensure you see whatever is on the gmail server calendar.

When you create an 'Event' or 'Task', by default it will name the Calendar at the top of the Event or Task window. The Calendar shown by default will always be whatever Calendar you currently had selected in the left Calendar pane. Either select the relevant Calendar first in left pane before clicking on 'New Event' OR manually alter it in the 'New Event' window using the drop down to see options.

Ideally, if you have a Calendar that your wife uses to print out a family weekly schedule then that is the calendar you need to use when creating Events or Tasks. But it's not vital. If you like separate calendars that's your choice. Either way, if all are visible then all the various Events or Tasks from all the various Calendars are still shown on one view.

To get a print out that shows all the accumulated Event data from all Calendars in one view: 1. Make sure all the Calendars listed are visible.

  • In left Calendar Pane - Click on any named Calendar 3 dot icon to see options and select 'Show all Calendars'

2. If synchronising with an external Calendar:

  • In left Calendar Pane - click on relevant Calendar 3 dot icon and select the Synchronise option.

3. 'File' > 'Print'

  • Layout: Select Monthly Grid or Weekly planner
  • Choose when it's From & TO eg: March 2026 OR select relevant week
  • It should display all the data from all the various Calendars.
  • Click on 'Next'
  • Choose all required settings and click on Print
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
mikedaly696 said
I successfully inclued my 3 email accounts but two of them only have inbox and trash folders none of other folders such as drafts, spam ,deleted or trash etc. folders.

By default newly created POP accounts only contain an Inbox and a Trash folder. The other special folders such as Sent, Drafts, Archives, .... will be created when you send or save or archive your first message in this account. A Spam folder will be created when you check "enable adaptive spam controls" in Account Settings > account name > Spam Settings ....

content:
I think this will work: click help>troubleshootinginformation scroll to 'profile folder' and click 'open folder' I think this should place you in the profile. the contacts are in abook.mab and history.mab copy them for your backup.

TIP: If you later decide to install a recent version of Thunderbird, the new contact files are in a different file format with different names (abook.sqlite and history.sqlite). You will need to use the tools>import>import from a file menu to import and convert the mab files to the newer sqlite format. Keep this information for whenever you later need it.

creator: balupton

content:
Unfortunately for those that coose to use apple contact via the apple app, you only get read only access to them in any other apps. SO the mess you speak of in evolution is an outshoot of this deliberate limitation placed by apple. Thunderbird just calls the thing read only and makes no attempt to do anything with the contacts other than list them really.

So I guess the question is, are your contacts supplied by icloud via the industry standard carddav or via the apple contacts on your machine which is read only.

Generally if the avatar is not showing correctly the advice is to update the contact avatar at icloud.com and allow the update to sync. As I use neither apple products, r any apple products truth be told, I can only regurgitate when I have heard, not what I know to be correct.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: @Matt, this is via contacts.icloud.com (apple's carddav server) via thunderbird via fedora linux, in which it is read-write, however the avatars are not supported in thunderbird, but are supported via evolution.

content:
probably by getting rid of your antivirus product.

I have basically nothing to run with. But most folk that loose their profile as you have done have issue with antivirus products. Those that get certificate error also usually have antivirus error. That you have experienced both makes me think you have a bad apple in your antivirus.

You may be able to recover your previous setting by going to the troubleshooting information on the help menu and selecting About:profiles. From there you can open your old profile, or at least find out what the issue with using it is and report that here for advice.

creator: ACProctor

content:
I've never heard of this being a general problem, and I used that version long ago but I don't recall that ever happening to me. But it's such an old, version I doubt you'll find many people here who can check. Is there some reason you don't use the most recent version for your computer platform?

The first thing I'd try would be to turn of Hardware Acceleration, which can sometimes cause display anomalies and in my experience makes little performance different. In most versions that setting is found somewhere in Tools | Settings | General, but it may be different for your old version.

Did you see this symptom with the previous version? If you prefer to not upgrade, you could downgrade to the next lower MINOR revision (like, go from 102.15.1 to 102.15.0) to see if that helps. Old versions can be found here:

https://releases.mozilla.org/pub/thunderbird/releases/

Another thing to consider is to see if there are more recent or better display drivers for your computer.

Most folk I have seen with your complaint are using IMAP and appear to have missed the fact it is syncronised to the mail server. So things come and go according to what is stored on the server.

Get the mail and delete it on your phone and the server synchronizes the deletion there t and that in turn synchronizes to Thunderbird.

content: No you need to disable whatever software is making Thunderbird non functional. Given the device is a Dell and they traditionally provide McAfee with their product preinstalled my guess is it will be that long term mail dysfunction causer that is the root of your issue All those folders you see in Thunderbird are caused by file contention and that is usually the antivirus locking up files when Thunderbird is trying to use them. You can start by deleting all of them. All this inbox folder all the nstmp folders and all of the compact backup folders.

content:
Gracias Gerardo, ya había probado esa opción pero no progresaba.

La solución es un poco enrevesada, en el sentido que primero hay que 'pedirle' una clave a Google. La secuencia es: 1) Desde la cuenta que quieras configurar ( en tu caso pepe@dominio.detucuenta.webmail ) desde la interfaz web vas a: 

   En  Aplicaciones de Google ( cuadro de 9 puntitos arriba a la derecha) "     Eliges el primero de los iconos "cuenta"    Seguridad e inicio de sesión    Verificación en dos pasos      Abajo verás "Contraseñas de Aplicaciones"    Crear la contraseña , Aplicación: Correo , Dispositivo: Otro , Nombre: Thunderbird    Pulsa Generar    Google te dará una contraseña de 16 caracteres,  Cópiala, no se vuelve a mostrar

Ahora esa contraseña la pegas en la configuración de Thunderbird al crear la cuenta y como 'Metodo de autentificación' 'Contraseña normal' (ver imagen).

Con eso al margen de los mensajes que muestre ya ha creado la cuenta correctamente

Gracias Gerardo, otra vez por tu ayuda

Monique Sibi said

The link leads to the Thunderbird 115.18.0.dmg to download it.

Actually Mozilla prefers we use archive.mozilla.org instead so https://archive.mozilla.org/pub/thunderbird/releases/115.18.0/mac/

Just click on the folder for language you want then download the Thunderbird 115.18.0.dmg

It will likely be one of these three English locals. en-CA/ en-GB/ en-US/

These links are basically as if you were downloading with FTP as there used to be ftp://ftp.mozilla.org until Mozilla turned off the ftp:// protocol on their servers back on August 5th, 2015.

content:
Thunderbird is not an email provider; it is an email client - the interface between you and your existing email provider.

Thundermail and Thunderbird Pro will be email providers, where you can create accounts and use Thunderbird (or any other client) to access them.

https://blog.thunderbird.net/2025/04/thundermail-and-thunderbird-pro-services/
creator: siffemoz

outgoing SMTP: mail.twc.com, 587, STARTTLS, normal password, email address
